easyQuestions.question: What is the "worst-case scenario" (O) in algorithms?
answers: The maximum number of steps an algorithm could take to complete, given the worst possible input
The efficiency of an algorithm when given random inputs
The average number of steps an algorithm takes to complete across all inputs
The fastest an algorithm can complete its task, given the best possible input
easyQuestions.correctAnswer: The maximum number of steps an algorithm could take to complete, given the worst possible input

easyQuestions.question: What is a characteristic of greedy algorithms?
answers: They explore all possible solutions before choosing the best one
They rely on dynamic programming to solve complex problems
They always guarantee the best solution in every scenario
They make the locally optimal choice at each step, aiming for a globally optimal solution
easyQuestions.correctAnswer: They make the locally optimal choice at each step, aiming for a globally optimal solution

easyQuestions.question: What is the purpose of "Divide and Conquer" algorithms?
answers: To prioritize the most significant part of a problem and ignore smaller details
To try every possible solution and pick the best one
To break a problem into smaller sub-problems, and solve them individually
To divide tasks among multiple algorithms running in parallel for faster processing
easyQuestions.correctAnswer: To break a problem into smaller sub-problems, and solve them individually

easyQuestions.question: What type of structure is a stack?
answers: A linear data structure that follows the First In, First Out (FIFO) principle
A hierarchical data structure used to represent parent-child relationships
A linear data structure that follows the Last In, First Out (LIFO) principle
A dynamic graph-based structure used for storing key-value pairs
easyQuestions.correctAnswer: A linear data structure that follows the Last In, First Out (LIFO) principle

easyQuestions.question: What is the key principle of "Merge Sort?"?
answers: Sorting by repeatedly partitioning the array around a pivot
Sorting by making the locally optimal choice at each step
Sorting by dividing the array into smaller subarrays, sorting them, and merging them back together
Sorting by iterating through the array and swapping adjacent elements if they are in the wrong order
easyQuestions.correctAnswer: Sorting by dividing the array into smaller subarrays, sorting them, and merging them back together

easyQuestions.question: Which data structure operates on a FIFO principle?
answers: Queue
Stack
Binary Tree
Hash Table

easyQuestions.question: What does the "spatial complexity" of an algorithm refer to?
answers: The amount of memory an algorithm uses as it runs
The time an algorithm takes to execute
The efficiency of an algorithm when processing large datasets
The structure of the data used by the algorithm
easyQuestions.correctAnswer: The amount of memory an algorithm uses as it runs

easyQuestions.question: What is the time complexity of accessing an element in an array?
answers: O(n)
O(log n)
O(n²)

easyQuestions.question: What is the purpose of an algorithm’s time complexity?
answers: To describe how the algorithm uses memory
To measure how fast the algorithm runs as the input size grows
To calculate how many elements an algorithm can process
To determine the minimum number of steps an algorithm takes
easyQuestions.correctAnswer: To measure how fast the algorithm runs as the input size grows

easyQuestions.question: What type of algorithm is used to find the shortest path between two nodes in a graph?
answers: Dijkstra’s Algorithm
Quicksort
Merge Sort
Binary Search

easyQuestions.question: What is a characteristic of a recursive algorithm?
answers: It solves problems in a linear sequence
It solves problems by breaking them down into smaller, identical sub-problems
It requires the algorithm to run iteratively
It always produces the fastest solution
easyQuestions.correctAnswer: It solves problems by breaking them down into smaller, identical sub-problems

easyQuestions.question: Which is an example of a non-linear data structure?
answers: Linked List
Binary Tree
Queue
Stack

In what game do players build and explore a blocky 3D world?
In which video game would you find the character 'Link'?
Name three Mario Kart items.
hardQuestions.correctAnswer: Mushroom, Banana, Star, Bullet Bill, Lightning, Blue Shell, Red Shell, Green Shell

What is the only fruit that has its seeds on the outside?
Which insect can live for weeks without its head?
Which animal has the longest tongue in proportion to its body?
Which planet has the most volcanoes in our solar system?
What is the only bird that can fly backward?
Which animals’s blood is blue due to the copper-based molecule it uses to carry oxygen?
Which microscopic animal is known to survive extreme conditions, including outer space?
